intro: Sphaeralcea rydbergii, commonly known as Rydberg's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves. Its structure includes a short stem with clusters of flowers at the tips of the branches. Sphaeralcea rydbergii is well adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
